fields.value: Maps of the spatially resolved line-of-sight velocity field of the Milky Way Interstellar Medium made with Kinetic Tomography

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Maps of the line-of-sight velocity field of the Milky Way ISM as a function of position in the Galactic plane. All velocities are in the heliocentric frame.
The procedure for deriving the gas and dust KT map is described in Kinetic Tomography. I. A Method for Mapping the Milky Wayâ€™s Interstellar Medium in Four Dimensions. (https://doi.org/10.3847/1538-3881/153/1/8).
The procedure for deriving the DIB KT map is described in Kinetic Tomography. II. A second method for mapping the velocity field of the Milky Way Interstellar Medium and a comparison with spiral structure models. This paper is currently under review. A pre-print is available on arXiv: https://arxiv.org/abs/1808.01286.

files.description:
First HDU: Heliocentric velocity (km/s) 
Second HDU: x-axis of a Cartesian grid centered on the Sun with the Galactic center located at positive x and y = 0 (kpc) 
Third HDU: y-axis of the same Cartesian grid (kpc)
files.label: DIB_KT_map.fits

dataFile.description:
First HDU: Heliocentric velocity (km/s) 
Second HDU: x-axis of a Cartesian grid centered on the Sun with the Galactic center located at positive x and y = 0 (kpc) 
Third HDU: y-axis of the same Cartesian grid (kpc)

files.description:
First HDU: Heliocentric velocity (km/s)
Second HDU: Longitude axis (degrees)
Third HDU: Distance axis (kpc); note that this axis is not evenly spaced
files.label: gas_dust_KT_map.fits
